PUMVrwSrxDOuwkeA1x_YSw.text: Every time I am in the North Shore, I make Bar Louie my destination.  I have tried many menu items, both food and drink.  I have loved them all. I am not generally a martini drinker, but I tried a variety of their martinis and have loved all of them! Their service is exceptional.  Each server, including bar tenders and managers are all friendly and truly care about your experience there. I definitely would recommend Bar Louie North Shore to any one!

3GzhoIkUddhP6p9_XqeBeg.text: Went with a group after a pirate game.   Great for larger groups.  Service was fast and efficient.   The waiter Algerone said he was brand new.   Would have thought he's been doing it for years.  He was wonderful.  Personable and pleasant even with the busy chaos.  Kept everything straight and even split checks with no hesitation.   They are fortunate to have him on staff.    Food is good,  reasonably priced , consistent and nice variety.

DrnhwTjnA6Zv-gobCAbK5w.text: Disappointing.....sloppy drinks, can't handle big crowds - definitely a place to avoid during busy times

Lz3YgcjHQki8s4T5n0U_1A.text: Great bar service!! Fast service and delicious martini choices. Definitely check it out if you are in the area for a game. Ask for Ariel!

FERAgD6uUVK8M7pdR6EDSQ.text: We decided to stop into Bar Louie before seeing a movie at Loews Theatre Saturday night.  As somebody who's worked in the service industry before, I can assure you their service is second to none. We were welcomed at the door, immediately taken care of by Andy at the bar, and our food and drinks were served promptly. I'm not usually inclined to leave reviews, but these guys get it and deserve to be recognized. One of the female managers Stephanie was also very nice and made sure we enjoyed our experience.  I think this review says it all.

Mk1vE098vsfzC_PGQJAxZA.text: Went here on a Tuesday evening for a drink before a concert. There was also a Pirates game and this place was DEAD. Still, there was no host/hostess, tables were full of uneaten food and nothing was bussed or cleaned. We sat ourselves and a server finally showed up. While the server was fine, the drinks we ordered took forever and there were only two other tables with patrons. We ordered nachos and calamari, both which came quickly but were literally disgusting. The calamari was extremely burnt and the nachos were cold and covered in the most disgusting excuse for guacamole I'd ever seen. I did not have any expectations for a place like this on the "North Shore" and luckily Bar Louie proved right. Never. Again.

GiEa-gfF8Y5BuiUnKjeQwQ.text: We had a birthday party at Bar Louie North Shore. It was fantastic. Our server Missy was the best. Recommend for parties or just for food and drink.

M-uuGnT_lXzu55zZHon-JA.text: The  place is really nice, decor, the people, and the strawberry lemonade sangria is great. But the food is not that good. I have been to Bar Louie at the waterfront and the food wasn't good there either. I was hoping it would be different. There are a lot of places to choose from in Pittsburgh now so you're going to have to step your game up.

wmD2o8OOtGtm0UTlyu5yEg.text: I'm a Bar Louie regular but I have never visited this particular restaurant. My friend and I sat at the bar and were greeted by the bartender who was the highlight of our trip here. The " regulars" at this establishment were rude and made the two of us ladies feel less than comfortable. Our bartender even told us that the men we rude. The food here was lackluster at best compared to the restaurant that I usually frequent. I'm currently writing this review while I'm sitting and waiting for what seems like forever for my check as these rude regulars continue to harass us. I honestly can't wait to leave. I wouldn't be opposed to giving this location a second chance but right this second sitting here waiting and being harassed I'm disgusted and can not wait to leave.

FbsFyYgBVsKbVJ8StOQLdQ.text: Great location for game days.  I was down for work and stopped in during lunch.  Busy place with great service and atmosphere.  Ate their version of Chicken Tacos and had a beer while sitting at the bar. Bartender was very attentive and wouldn't even let me finish my beer before asking if i would like another (i like this btw!).  Overall, awesome place and look forward to stopping in when i go to Pirates/Steelers games.

Me-mCNFmxitpdWmeyKSkyA.text: Before I came to bar Louie my night was not going very welll but once I got here the service was great, we did not not have to wait long for our drinks and I got the pretzels appetizer and it was delicious. Aerial our bartender was great! Highly recommend coming here!

P9P7V7WLVxgsPNggPDyD8g.text: Love this place! My husband and I always stop here before any concert or pirate game we attend. The food is delicious, especially the loaded tots! Great service too, I never have to wait too long for someone to take my order. I've never had a bad experience here. I highly recommend Bar Louie!

u0qwTV6mIoIx1-ZEuj_Mlw.text: The food order came out wrong, what did come out was ice cold and the service was awful. Save yourself the trouble and money.

kSYLovrZdbpH-6dIPLPD-A.text: Nice place. Great Chicken nachos.....the best I've had eating out!

8jUCmpEzObz0WPasIPKz4Q.text: This is my wife and I's go to spot before a concert and a game. Super attentive staff.  We love the loaded nachos and the draft selection is always solid. It is great if you are in a hurry for an app they always accommodate when we are in a hurry.

eQco7Ndb97ta1UNHGSibgg.text: Yikes. Stopped in before a concert. I ordered the boneless wings. Not only did they take forever to come out but once they did half of them were raw. Not just a little pink, straight up raw. The manager was apologetic and comped it but that was disturbing. We tried the nachos next, they were o.k nothing special. North shore has so many good options, skip bar louie!

ZCVLUozj9DWXJ0p2iROaCg.text: Can't review the food or drink because my party left after not being acknowledged. Sat down at the bar around 10:00 pm (posted closing time was 2:00 am) and the place was empty. Multiple employees and bartenders visible. Male bartender looked at us multiple times and said nothing. We left after 10-15 minutes. There are many better options in the area like The Foundry and Southern Tier.

C2Hziqx9N88B2TmA9VtiIw.text: Terrible service. My friends and I came here before a pirate game and went 50 minutes without a bartender stopping by to ask if we needed another drink or our bill, etc.

D50kiEYwOWSXJXd9AE8S2g.text: We had a fabulous afternoon here all thanks to our server Missy!! She was helpful, fun, and very attentive to our large group of 20+ people! Thank you Missy and Bar Louie on the North Shore for making our day wonderful!

H5br3YietTHSlv9ISomyUQ.text: Bar Louie in the North Shore has the most accommodating, friendly staff you could ever ask for. We hosted a last minute surprise party for a friend and everything from the quality of the food to the service was exceptional. Missy was the greatest most attentive server ever!  Kudos to Missy and Bar Louie!!!

FvgflETgfqCUfw4JCg_Kvw.text: I've been to plenty of Bar Louie's but this one was by far the worst. I stopped in before a Pirates game and was surprised to see it was pretty dead. That should have been a good indication that this wasn't going to go well. I grabbed a seat at the bar which literally only two other patrons were at. The bartender took over 10 mins to greet me. I'm not sure what she was doing but she was so slow. As it picked up a bit she seemed to get in the weeds pretty fast. Icing on the cake was when I asked for their gluten free menu which Bar Louie has she had no clue what I was talking about. Either she's just clueless or their training is terrible. Either way, I left and had dinner next door instead.

eUOVvEjIv_j4zwckWVEuTQ.text: If you can't handle a game day crowd, why open a restaurant next to a baseball stadium? We attempted to go here before the Pirates game tonight. We snagged what appeared to be the last inside table. And then waited. And waited. Hardly any wait staff on the floor.  Waited some more.  After 15 minutes absolutely unacknowledged, we walked out. No visible hostess or manager or anyone to even tell why we were leaving. Normally I'd chalk this up to an off night, but my husband has had a similar experience here previously.

11hRyBZBVxQh4HONaZnVyw.text: Al (not Albert) was fantastic. Give him a raise. He was very helpful and very kind throughout our visit.

O5Wgw7EcTBWCmV43sLBPwg.text: I've been coming to bar Louie for over 10 years. There is always great food, great drinks, great service, and a very enjoyable atmosphere. Definitely my number one choice on the North Shore!

BKmIV_jxP2gdU-aUJEYFzQ.text: Good food. Decent service. The north shore was super crowded so we had to go here since they had lots of open tables. We got nachos which were good but toppings were only on half the nachos. The drafts are poured in 16oz glasses. Also, they advertise for free apps by signing up on a phone app but they're not actually available until 24 hours later. I'd go back but I'd prefer some of the other north shore bars.

1z9_f3tsJ91x0ZCcraiN1g.text: Came here before an event at rivers casino. Our server was super sweet and fast! Thanks missy! Was surprised by how reasonable the prices were for happy hour. This makes bar Louie my #1 recommendation for a place to go before any event on the north shore- the prices and service can't be beat. Drinks were great too- lemon drop martini wasn't too sweet. Had the calamari and the spice was awesome. Will definitely be back.

2lNp0w4ttbNG60LVwWLf3g.text: "The absolute worst service we've ever had in our life"..... this is the quote from my lady friend as we drank at this horrible bar. Only giving it one star, because i can't give it 0 stars. We have given bar Louie 3 chances in the timeframe of one week. Where should I begin.... actually on all of our visits, we noticed that Bar Louie was the only bar on the north shore that wasn't full of people. I guess that should have been a sign.   On visit 1, we asked for a couple of basic martinis off of the menu. One was basically all mix, and pretty awful tasting. The other was defiantly not the vodka i had asked for. We would have ordered a second round, but it appeared that the bar staff were more interested in cleaning and stocking the bar at 10 pm on a Friday night than waiting on any of the customers that were at the bar.   On visit 2, (again on another Friday night), we decided to try to grab some food before the Pirates game. We were able to be seated immediately on the patio, where our group waited for nearly 20 minutes before a server stopped by and said "i guess i can take your order if you want something". It took forever for our drinks and food to arrive.  After we had drinks at several other bars after the Bucco game, our party ended up at Bar Louie, again, because it was pretty much empty and there were tons of bar seats. However, one very apparent person there was a Pittsburgh police officer that pretty much just kept circling the bar, watching patrons, while only about 10 people were in the whole joint. It set a strange vibe, as there were no other police roaming the much more crowded bars on the north shore. Around 1230am, it was pretty apparent that the bar staff was really wanting to close. They were mostly making poor attempts to look busy sweeping or cleaning, while ignoring all new customers, and also ignoring giant tubs of disgusting dirty dishes were laying around behind the bar, and more dirty dishes were laying all over the bar. When we were able to flag down a bartender, she again made us two basic martinis off of the menu. She handed them to us, where i promptly noticed that something black was floating in my fiancee's drink. The olives in my Martini were disgusting, and very old tasting. It was pretty gross. Her drink was replaced with something different, when the lights in the whole place came on full bright at about 12:55. People walking in after this were refused service and turned away. Just a few minutes later, last call was given, even though it was about an hour from closing time. It was all very odd.   All in all, we usually like Bar Louie's apps and drinks, but this location is just awful, pretty much because of the staff and atmosphere they set. This is clearly the reason this bar is nearly always empty compared to surrounding places. We look for it to be closed soon If this level of service continues.

QOieeWXD8w6gDfl9HRGhLQ.text: Fast efficient stop for food after a Pirates game. Great service and decent food at a price you would expect convenient to stadium venues!

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QhjSNV4V78Dza7X9v87JeA.text: Bar Louie is terrible. I wish the management would respond to some of the horrible reviews on here and correct the shortcomings of their restaurant/bar. We stopped in around 10pm last Saturday and the bar was semi-full. I think the only reason people were here was because the line for Tequila Cowboy wrapped around the block. We sat ourselves and proceeded to order some beers from the friendly waitress. The unfortunate thing was they were out of a lot of the various beers. Then, we went to order appetizers and guess what they were out of a few of those too! How does that even happen? The north shore is definitely happening on the weekends now so why wouldn't you be prepared appropriately? Anyways, when the appetizers came out, they were luke warm and mediocre at best. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The nachos looked old and not appetizing

yB0ouzyOyVpInLtR4KD-4Q.text: First time for me and my hubby at Bar Louie, and we a great time!  Happy hour is from 5-7, most appetizers are half off and $3.50 drafts (with a huge selection).  Everything was delicious!  The service was amazing. Our waiter, Tim, went above and beyond, and he helped us choose some really great appetizers from the menu.  He started us off with the Thai and the Chicken Verde flatbreads (which I probably wouldn't have ordered on my own), and they were amazing!!  The spinach artichoke dip was also very good.  Then, we split a Voodoo Sandwich which had so many different flavors and was sooooo good!  Thanks to everyone at Bar Louie for a great evening. We will definitely be returning. I highly recommend giving this place a try!

y5zvQm4EBohiFSiSBZGZcw.text: Had a really unfortunate experience at Bar Louie tonight, definitely will not be back. Sharing this because there are a lot of choices in the north shore, and this place should be embarrassed.   Let's start with the service and the restaurant itself. Absolutely disgusting. There is no hostess so you kinda seat yourself. No problem but maybe put a sign up or something so people aren't just waiting there.   Floor was sticky and there was trash everywhere. I get it was a busy day earlier, but at least make an attempt to keep up with it. Bathrooms were also absolutely disgusting. Waitress took about 15 minutes to even acknowledge us. Ordered drinks. 20 minutes later, nothing. We ended up going to the bar to get some waters ourselves in the meantime.   Ordered a Moscow mule, which, after taking forever to even get there, tasted like chemicals. Everyone who worked there seemed to be standing around. When our drinks did not come, we went up to the bar as previously mentioned, and the bartenders were more interested in flirting than caring about the customers. We waited there several minutes before either acknowledged us, or stopped feeding French fries to each other to notice we were there.   Food took a very long time, and the restaurant was not crowded at all. We ordered nachos. I think they would have been okay if they weren't cold. Obviously they'd been sitting out for a while before coming to our table. Ordered a chicken sandwich which was burnt. No one else seemed thrilled with their food in our party, everyone was just hungry so we are it.   Not a positive experience, they should be ashamed of how they treat their customers, I'm surprised this place is still open. Plenty of other north shore bars, there's no reason to go here.

gem78r1HgPXfBI6Q_CqqRw.text: Waited 25 minutes for a table all to find out they only own 2 child seats for the whole restaurant and both were occupied. Our reservation was for 3 and a high chair. Only thing they could do is say sorry.  We watched a table get sat with a high chair that we had been waiting longer than. Poor management.  I do not recommend this place with kids.

-hh9tTtYkQSMvqLO6eRQfA.text: We went to Bar Louie on Saturday afternoon, March 24, 2018 and had a great meal. I am wondering why this location has such a low Yelp rating.??? The place was not busy on Saturday because nothing was really going on in town. We sat ourselves, which is customary I suppose when they're not busy, and not a problem at all. We were my daughter, her boyfriend and me. We ordered apps (chicken lettuce wraps and the hummus platter) which I thought were very good! For lunch, my daughter went off-menu and got a macaroni and cheese with chicken SANDWICH! She loved it! Her boyfriend got the pulled pork sandwich platter and he really liked it. I got the blackened cod tacos which came with rice, black beans, pico, guac and the BEST verde sauce I've ever had. I even asked the waitress to let the kitchen know I said that and she did. The kitchen manager came out to chat and thank us for the compliment.  I don't know what some people's problems are with this place but we had a great meal during an off time and still got fresh, house-made food! We will definitely be back! Thank you!

6cOheF607Orj2k3L8VTBhQ.text: Since the location at Station Square shut down, we haven't been able to find one to visit until we were in the North Shore area last weekend. I didn't know about this location and was excited to go. Our service was good but it took a little longer to get our drinks but that was okay since that's all we ordered. The wait staff was very nice and the restaurant was very clean. It was busier than I would have preferred but that's what you get on a Saturday night.

E7C56DnaK9a_aw7hU57qTQ.text: While the scene is nice looking the service on the other is slow and pitiful I have been waiting over hour and counting to receive my food I am very disappointed

BuzIuVM57oYmYFGgrIHdtA.text: Had a wonderful time! Torri had wonderful service. Food was great and the drinks were better.

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

R3ZXTecoR4FkbDTa61L-pg.text: Cocktails were excellent and the bartender was very personable. It was a very chill atmosphere and the drinks were fantastic! The burgers were cooked perfectly--we had a great time when we visited.   The menu was original and presented a wide variety of options that could satisfy any level of appetite, from slightly hungry to starving. The cocktails were creative and original. I recommend the Royally Buzzed cocktail; I've never had anything quite like it. It's slightly pricey, but contains ALL of the liquor and is definitely worth it. Highly recommend this restaurant!!

eBf4VI6Q9bkbyHEq1DfI9A.text: If I could give this place zero stars- I would. Stopped in after beer fest for a cocktail and appetizer. Our waiter was orienting which I figured would make them more attentive.... NOPE. Ordered one drink and never did they visit the table to ask us order for over 45 minutes. Finally gave up and asked flagged someone down for the check. Will not be visiting again- waste of time.

kPBkI7wJ5paU99eMOl-8Og.text: We had a ladies night out in Saturday.  We arrived and we were seated in the front section.  Our server, Algeron, was so friendly and greeted us with a big smile.  He must really enjoy working there because his smile was present all evening.  We were there for a drinks.  He was very familiar with the special cocktails and made wonderful suggestions.  His friendly outgoing personality made our evening much more enjoyable.

0QvMvY8i0XGIlePNaE-nQQ.text: I have not been here for a while and our bartender Bill was great very attentive to not just only me and my friend but the entire bar was taken care of. He's very down to earth and gave great recommendations we got the Soft Pretzel appetizer which Bill recommended which were good and just what we needed! Thanks Bill for the great service we will come back again for great service like yours!

2mjCIMOXW3YYZSAtZvXRxA.text: First time here after walking by no less than a hundred times, and it was great! My friend and I split the Pineapple Express sangria which was delicious and not too sweet and we both heartily enjoyed our meals. Samantha was fantastic - super accommodating with our rather indecisive selves, great conversationalist, and a pro at handling the drunk table next door and keeping them happy and quiet for the rest of us. Will definitely be back again for happy hour!

GRR6VYDpa4iUavxE7qrtfw.text: We were planning on getting together with my daughter and her friends tonight for her birthday so I wanted to look at the reviews. I was disappointed to read so many negative reviews because I have been to Bar Louie's at Station Square,  years ago, and it was pretty good.    I was contemplating selecting another bar for happy hours, but saw that the manager reached out to one of the authors of a negative review and said he would like to make it right.  That is impressive and makes me want to give it a shot.  Hope we aren't disappointed.

KI2TsMG-d0N4NPJkN3MhZg.text: Marissa and Amanda made this my favorite Pittsburgh spot! Great drinks and staff! The only spot to go to

qkU5YeaIjlFYtirZVxgbtQ.text: Really fun atmosphere with awesome and very fun staff. Our food and drinks came out promptly. They have an excellent happy hour selection. I got the bruschetta pomodoro. It was really good but I wish I added the shrimp. Had my first martini there and really enjoyed the one recommended to me by our server.

_zUbO76jpqGYPQu99Gu7wA.text: Was super impressed with the service especially on game day was seated and service immediately. Had the shrimp lettuce wraps which were awesome great flavors very fresh and tasty. Super quick service,very friendly staff highly recommend this spot

Y0f1x3oAPoQdswQTbjUBvg.text: Had a great experience at the bar Louie in the north shore last night. Marissa was serving us and she was quick and efficient. Her drinks were amazing. Definitely going to go back and ask for Marissa

O8fdNMAtwqSXQAvb6Qa94Q.text: Stopped in with a group that ended up having a number of friends who came in after we were seated. Our server Ashley was extremely friendly and accommodating and made it a great experience for an extended happy hour.

S_0-tA4MwtAMGCDZxNPCJw.text: Great ambience and the one bartender is really handsome and also very nice. Great for all occasions. If I could give 1000 stars I would.

ABifsSP04_1PbM54yQmGRw.text: Stopped by this spot after the Steelers game and Ashley was a total rockstar. I literally watched her run from table to table. We gave her a convoluted order and she didn't even write it down. Nailed it. Food was great, DJ was playing old school hip-hop, a great time.

p1KOgKBjq0m7Sgg0Pu9kdQ.text: I want to like this chain. They boast good drinks, tasty food, and fun times. Every time I have gone, however, I've been met with lame beers on tap, lackluster food, and  benign neglect from the wait staff. The final straw for me was tonight's visit. I went for an alleged "Arts and Crafts" event where they were supposed to have ARTS (crayons, paper, etc.) and CRAFT Beers galore, plus $5 Impossible Burgers. They had 1 of those, and unfortunately it was the Impossible (To Eat) burger. As a longtime vegan, I was looking forward to a thick, juicy plant-based burger, and was incredibly disappointed when an over cooked, crunchy patty on a bun with wilted lettuce showed up at my table. I had to chase down a hostess to get silverware and napkins for the table, after the food arrived. Louie, I wish you the best. I will not be back.

AfG5PI0dlbxtmjkfw6SbVw.text: I liked this place, best for happy hour drinks and food. I think the service can be improved more and that will get them 5 stars. Anyways we had good time here for couple of hours before going home from office!!

gAC0GMNG1J3bhnuMr5EWyg.text: Jake was outstanding. Made the best Effen vodka martini EVER. Seriously though... very accommodating and friendly!! Attentive staff and delicious food! Will defiantly be back again.

VznesSWgyqQjRnT8Rq8sFA.text: Great food and service, only place on north shore for happy hour. Our server Ashley did a fantastic job today!

5XRT8IcbDvbyYQRO-Rb8_g.text: I'm giving 5 stars for one MAIN reason. SERVICE!!!  We were thwarted from our original venue who dropped the ball for a birthday party/ scavenger hunt.  Bar Louie totally accommodated us immediately. With a group of about 40, this was a quick accommodation.   Immediately we were greeted by Missy who jumped in to a rambunctious group gathering individual drink orders throughout before we got started. Returning about 2 hours later she picked right up and kept us drinking, laughing, food going and cleaning up around us. Never without a smile on her face.   The food is always good here. I probably wouldn't have considered having a group event here before, but will most definitely in the future and will request Missy for my server!!

ZKecowia-F0qdH-IROjaiw.text: I came here for Veterans Day for the free appetizers and burger, and boy, was I not disappointed! The verde chicken flat bread paired with the Bulleit Bourbon burger was a great mix! Add some bumble berry beer and Pineapple Express sangria and you have a party! It took a while to get some service as they were packed but our waitress was very attentive to our needs and recommended some tasty drinks! Yes, overpriced but also worth it as it was a night worth celebrating!

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2ZXfJSti5RcCVGCuRqxJCg.text: I've been here three times in the past month - not by choice.  Over all of my visits, I ordered the chicken quesadilla twice, chicken nachos, and spinach and artichoke dip.  The chicken quesadilla was good the first time (except the guacamole is like no guacamole I've ever seen - whole chunk of avocado, really dark green, really not good), but the third visit, it was burnt and dry.  The chicken nachos come with a ton of toppings (incl the weird guac), but somehow still have no taste.  The dip also had very little taste, and the chips were stale.  The third visit was at 2 PM on a weekday, but they had the "Event Menu" on the table.  The Event Menu is really limiting, so I asked the waitress, "Is this the menu for today?"  and she said yes, but then huffily said, "Do you want a regular menu?"  You either offer the full menu, or you don't.  We were the only people in there, and I feel like they just wanted to stick with the smaller menu.  The menu she brought me was sticky, with soda spilled on it.  Like, the pages were stuck together, and the first two pages actually ripped when I tried to turn the page. I resorted to the Event Menu because I didn't want to touch that thing any longer.  The kids' meals say that they come with a dessert.  The first visit, they brought it right out.  The second time, I had to request it, and the waiter seemed confused.  The third visit, the waitress brought out the check and never mentioned it, and I just wanted to leave.    Cost for me and two kids was about $50 each time.  WAY overpriced.  Never again.

EuooHKQn6rfEdPcfKrFaAw.text: Ok service. Expensive menu. Mediocre Food.   I came here before a pre-season steeler's game and just missed happy hour. So my effin' good martini was $11. Too much for me. Having sad that, it was tasty & refreshing. I also ordered the thai chicken flatbread. I was disappointed. The peanut sauce was very strange tasting and it overtook every other flavor on the pizza. The chicken was barely there and there wasn't really any other toppings on it. I had to take most of the peanut sauce off to make it eatable. Our meal of three drinks, one flatbread and a sandwich came to $50. Outrageously overpriced for the quality of the food you are getting.

5TAjvohG-c214t7nXzhYzA.text: We've been these 3 times and we're never disappointed. The staff is friendly and attentive. Great place for drinks and eats before or after a game.

uSx98ztw97LgVEYeZaPEsA.text: We paid $20 for two beers. This place is a complete rip off.  You know beer is $10 in the stadium, it should not be in the bars.  Louie can kiss my ass.

hJY_j9fJ9jclsglLe9UADA.text: Seriously the worst. This is the third time I've been to Bar Louie and it's progressively gotten worse. It took 40 minutes to get 2 sandwiches to go (we were 2 of 7 people in the restaurant). I finally got a bartenders attention who went to check on our order. When we got it, it wasn't correct and was missing ranch. Another 10 minutes had passed before the manager brought out my ranch. At this point it had been 55 minutes and not one person had been by to close out our tab. I walked outside at this point. Apparently the manager wanted to take care of our tab which was nice but would not have been necessary if they had their act together. Not going back.

za5UCSF0_2AUkx6SukPI6A.text: Awesome sauce type of place! Best happy hour on the north shore (Mon to Fri 5 to 7) 3.50 -14 oz draft, 4.50- glasses of wine, 5.50- signature martinis, and half off selected apps! Doesn't matter if your young or old, the atmosphere is welcoming of all types of ppl and a comfortable place to hang! The servers are down to earth friendly and fun.

vJiGB_L4sOzZCTwIFuWsIg.text: The worse meal I have had in a very long time. Waited over forty five mintues for two sandwhiches. When we finally received our meal it was so greasy we were unable to eat. Would noy go back again!

Cl-Wx4TNxBZE4mCRMtkyLA.text: When we were in Pittsburgh we were going to stop at Jerome Bettis's restaurant but it was closing so we went across the street to Bar Louie instead and to my surprise it was a great place! Nice huge bar, live music, lots of TV's good food and great drinks. The atmosphere was great. If it was a little warmer it would have been nice to sit outside too. Highly recommend this place.

t8GgOns4zmGLfh4Nz_pmBg.text: Marissa is the best. Honestly, don't think I've ever met a better bar Louie representative.  1st round draft pick.

5_nBdzc7-M9ZFODvcsoWGA.text: Extremely poor service and food is not worth the long waits. Staff is not responsive and manager was not helpful. This place is an overflow for Burghatory next door. Wait the 45 minutes for a good meal somewhere else and don't waste it here.

2m1gCO5xRVUEZYZ5DE1gPQ.text: Food is inconsistent. Service is poor. Never going back. Brought out wrong drinks. No kids menu because their printer wasn't working. Food over cooked. Been to other locations and this one clearly struggling in the kitchen and service. Probably due to poor management.

It comes with rice and beans and guac and salsa. I wouldn't order the burgers unless they make a bigger patty. The service was good and the inside is nicely decorated.

aZOll3u5euk2adV5JtbkZA.text: The service was terrible. We sat for 10 minutes before my wife had to ask the hostess to track down our server. The food was slow getting to the table and was cold. My wife  never got a single refill on water, and we had get up and  ask the bartender for eating utensils napkins.  Will not be going back.

rGdt9HM4-LOTVwllcdP-tQ.text: Yea Marissa was a cool bartender I guess. But really she made good drinks and suggested great food. Happy customer.

gCy7u0KAnQzelzzFQLXArQ.text: We went to have a drink and grab dinner before the Pirates game on a Friday night, we walked in and were told that there was no seating outside (when there clearly was) the hostess then convinced us to stay because it was happy hour and we wouldn't be able to sit outside anywhere else anyways (even though we easily could have) so reluctantly we stayed. We were obviously in a rush with our pirates gear and the game starting at 7:05, and tried ordering our food and drinks at the same told and our waiter told us that we couldn't. After an hour of waiting and our waiter never came over to see how we were doing if needed anything, finally he came over and told us that our food be right out, and asked again what one of us ordered confusing what they ordered with a salad instead of a sandwich like they had ordered. 15 more minutes pass by and our waiter is avoiding our table, and seeing people who has sat down long after us receive their food, the manager comes to tell us again, that our food will be right out and asks us if we need anything, and we state that we are good on water and drinks. He brings us out chips and salsa. Another 15 minutes and I finally get my chicken Caesar salad, no one else got their order, and I got my entree before my appetizer. 10 more minutes and my friends finally get their sandwiches and I get my spinach & artichoke dip which the chips were not totally cooked and honestly Applebee's has a better spinach and artichoke dip. My friend's fries were cold and yet again entrees before appetizers. Our one friend still didn't receive their food. At this point it's 7:20 and we've gotten half of our order after putting it in over an hour before. 7:30 and we all have our meals and appetizers, yet our waiter never bothers to come over, ask if there is anything that can be cleared, refills needed, or how the food is. Finally our waiter comes over to hand us coupons for free appetizers at our next visit, I can promise you I will not be returning, so if you're looking to be a half hour late, starving, and thirsty, I have a free coupon for you. Hit me up.

VLKqjprOcDTRCU-A-eKCzQ.text: Terrible service, we waited 50 minutes for food and the restaurant was only half full!

_Ao0wAVUMyvW3y75diLt6w.text: Super yummy margarita until I see the lime is inside my drink. It didn't really make me think about how gross bar fruit until it was an ugly brown like mixed into my drink. Nice waitress though

8AhDdvaZai0IU6Kr16SQNA.text: $56 for cold wings, a soggy salad, and two watered down drinks. Not to mention terrible service. Stay far, far away.

7avV2ciuevigf3Ra3IHcLA.text: When we arrived there were 4 adults and a baby. The greeter had an attitude about the stroller. She then brought a high chair that we didnt ask for and was rude that we didn't want to put the baby in it. The table she prepared for us was dirty and sticky. The manager came over and took our drink orders. We were seated near the bar and the kitchen. It took 20 mins to get our drinks. We watched the bar staff touch ever garnish including ours and a server licking her fingers as she delivered food. We ordered a second round of drinks. My husband was given a smaller beer in a plastic cup but charged the same price as the larger beer. No explanation for this. We counted 21 staff members and only the bartenders and 1 waitress, whom wasn't ours, was actually doing much work. 50 mins after arriving we received our food. A chicken sandwich 2 burgers and a Tuscan chicken pasta. Evertthig was cold except the fries. We complained to the manager but he only offered us a basket of fries. We declined and asked for the bill. That took forever also. We spent 2 hours there with the worst service I have ever experienced, cold food, and unhappy waitstaff. All that we could do was laugh about it.

HGSZZMfSG3FV4zT0DuXwBw.text: Walked in had to seat ourself which is no problem. Waiter walks over and said we will be right with you. We continued to sit there for 30mins with no drinks or menus. Watched the bartender ignoring customers with her face buried in her phone instead of helping her coworkers. During this time a table had to go to the bar to get their refills they were waiting on. Sad to say that we will never come back. They weren't that busy and appear to be extremely under staffed.

MGgicJY2uLZYonB-f6NzpA.text: We had a great experience at this place. Devin was such a great bartender. Very personable and great conversation.  She recommended the fish and chips. It was an amazing recommendation. We would definitely come back to Bar Louie. Thank you Devin for making our night.

Mx9cFMhU8cbY_cipeSHhKQ.text: Sat at bar for 15 minutes and didn't even get asked how we were so we left. Everyone else was surveys but not us.

QWXq_pWP5-9Ub6z43me4aA.text: Food is delicious and at the perfect price point! Can't beat the happy hour and $2 burgers on Tuesday's!! Chantel is a FANTASTIC server there! She can give you the perfect Bar Louie experience!!

mdEQK5tyTJlRIgbHJUKSug.text: Went here on Dec. 26 at 2pm. May have (at most) 20 people in the building.  Despite being a ghost town, 20 minutes to get drink orders and 40 minutes to be waited on on for food orders. Had to sit and listen to rationalization of understaffing issues.  Spent an hour and half to get and eat orders of burgers...yes, burgers.  Some items ordered were identified as not available from menu until 30 minutes after ordering. When I go to a restaurant , I get it, sometimes issues. I don't want to sit and listen as to why I have been failed.   Got a message from Chad,  director of operations.  Thank you for your concern and your request for feedback. Let me know, if there is anything I can do to help you and your team to improve. After all, as a customer, it's up to me to to teach you a bout customer satisfaction and experience. God forbid that would be part of your responsibility. Let me know the result of your "investigation".  Perhaps a mere mortal can help you out. You should be embarrassed by your own response.

PewNZ8iSqqHi6feSSGiONg.text: I have been here twice now, the first time the food was okay. Half of it came out cold and the spinach dip was just not good at all.  The one lady I was with wasn't crazy about her meal, the server was super nice and brought her another meal to go.   Tonight we came just for drinks. The bartender was so weird it was uncomfortable. A guy who was obviously training came up and asked him what a drink was and his reply was "I hate that drink, I refuse to make it". He then started making a drink with Titos, the bottle ran out and he finished making it with Grey Goose. He then scooped ice up with the glass, that is literally the first thing you learn not to do bartending.  The bar was not even busy, so use that excuse all you want, but it is never excusable.   Be prepared when you visit the establishment and maybe leave a low review, you will probably (like I did) get a message from an employee harassing you. Very professional.   Maybe I have too high of expectations, but I have no interest in ever coming back.

wMvPa528EAasrjXXoRlSiw.text: I will never patronize another Bar Louie ever again. $3.20 for a coke? Seriously??? Not a rum and coke.. but just a coke... simple fountain beverage.  Not even a refill.. just one (1).  I wonder how much a glass of water from the facet would cost??   If they overcharge for 1 coke, what else are they over charging??  To me this is a red flag. .. think about it..  Very disappointing.. never ever again..

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. what a disgrace.. $3.20 for a coke?!!   Folks.. its not a rum and coke... just a coke

3jJ4RTkcdo8N8D3pBIEbew.text: I stopped in on Sunday night after a game. It was packed and we had to find our own seats. I expected service to be awful right away but our server was great. I was actually surprised.   The food however was not good. I got the lettuce wraps and it was almost too salty to eat. My fiance got a burger that he asked for medium well but came out medium rare. An honest mistake considering how loud it was. But the food server didn't even ask if he wanted to send it back she just did. And they just threw the burger back on the grill for a few minutes. The end result was a well done dry as hell puck.   I've only ever been to Bar Louie when other people want to go. I usually try to talk them out of it. It's never an option for me personally.

OyMZgjnkxghzntns6X-0wQ.text: I literally cannot stop raving about my experience at Bar Louie! This place is huge and offers so many great seating options! It's very clean, spacious, and trendy. I was in a party of 10, and we sat outside. Torriona was our server, and she was absolutely fantastic!!! She took such great care of all of us. When 10 people order different drinks, different meals, and ask for separate checks, it can be a server's nightmare and be very easy to mess up... but not for Torri! She really hooked us up! Not ONE of the 10 members of our party had a complaint. Between all of us, we had burgers, tacos, and lots of different appetizers. I tried a little bit of everything, and every single thing was delicious. Omg the bruschetta was by far the best thing I ate. Torri even brought us extra bread to use so we could eat every last drop of it lol. I would highly suggest everyone in Pittsburgh eat at Bar Louie. They get a 10/10 for sure.

ijBoH9hGHYKhwcolEbeBHA.text: We are here before the Steeler game and sat down in a booth to wait for our friends. Our server, Sam came over and talked with us for 5-10 min about the area and the restaurant. She was so personable and fun, we would absolutely come back to ask for her!! Impressed with the table availability too! Can't wait to try to hot coca shots

JwTNPZeFN_vMYKtU9wSwRg.text: Stopped in here before a game and had a decent experience, mostly because the waitress was on point! She did a great job managing the outdoor section (which filled quickly after we sat down) on a cold night. The place was pretty crowded inside so she had a few issues getting our beers quickly.  We had the chicken lettuce wraps and a few beers, which adds up since it was the 'pregame menu'. The wraps were decent, but were a little too salty for our liking and the beers were on "happy hour special", but were still pretty expensive for miller lite. If you are looking for a place pre-heinz field or PNC park, not a bad stop, but I wouldn't head there otherwise.

km3ZxMzorZNqM1VB6coaUQ.text: This is great local eatery!  Food was great! I had the fish sandwich.  It was great! Great happy hour specials! My server Ashley was great! She made sure my drinks and dinner met my expectations!

1ac12_F1-ELtLOk4DJeJjA.text: While visiting Pittsburgh for work, I ate here last night and it was great! Food was awesome (had the salmon sliders which were fantastic, and the voodoo pasta which was super flavorful). They have a long list of beers on tap too.   It was a bit cold in the restaurant but after speaking with the manager Kevin, he fixed it right away. Perfect service. I will be dining here again in the future.

tbFyMuFYYaU1xV337YFbvw.text: I went to Bar Louie on the North Shore with some of my friends around 1:45 a.m. on January 13, 2019. When we arrived, the brunette bartender with glasses was extremely rude and unfriendly. She told us that she already did last call at 1:40. My friend offered to pay double and she still refused to serve us but proceeded to serve other bar patrons. The men drinking beside us saw what happened and tried to order us a drink from their blonde bartender. The brunette bartender with glasses came back and yelled at us for yelling at the blonde bartender when we never even spoke to her!!!! She then proceeded to tell us that other bar patrons had been waiting over an hour and a half for a drink. Really?! Does your service suck that much?!? After the way my friends and I were treated, we will not be back. I would give this establishment 0 stars if I could.   I would fire your brown haired bartender with glasses or you'll be getting a lot more reviews like this one.

0Fymgfe738pnoaHTZBif2Q.text: Had Algeron waiting on our table on a Saturday night and the guy was awesome.  Kept each persons tabs straight after multiple rounds of musical chairs and was very attentive to our group.  12/10 would ask for him as their waiter.

AcAkUsyTABhZH59D3SFhJw.text: What an experience! Simply went for a girls night out and it ended up turning into an awesome dining and bar experience. The server we had was named AJ. He was very friendly and didn't mind taking the time to explain the dishes on the menu, what he thought was best (including the drinks). He was very attentive and made sure our drinks were filled.  We started with an app of the tempura shrimp. The shrimp were fried and served with three different sauces of all tasteing pallets. The entree i had, was a surprise chosen by AJ, the Blackened salmon sliders. There were three sliders served with thick cuts of salmon and a side of fries. The sliders had a pesto mayo on them that added to the great flavor.  The atmosphere is friendly. The time we came, on a Saturday around 5pm, was not busy and allowed the service to be extra! The prices of drinks is a little much, but the service and food out way that. Thank you for a awesome girls night! Means a lot!

Bx7JP3DJHOz0L2L7KEeGFg.text: I have been to this location two times now and I'm so disappointed. I use to love bar Louie and thought they where such a great place to eat. I use to go to the one in station square all the time before it closed down. But anymore I'm just so disappointed with the service and the quality of food. You would think being open in the north shore by some big name food places even stage ae, pnc park, Heinz field. You would think they would strive for quality and sadly I think that's last. I wanted to come one more time before I wrote a review being I thought it was a bad night but I was wrong. The first time the food was slow and way to over cooked. Each time I been here it's been after 7pm and no ones here. They even seem over staffed in front of the house but I guess that's different for the kitchen. I wanted to give the wings a try one last time and once again disappointed. Way to over cooked Once again I just don't understand. I'm assuming it's the wings them self coming in large batches messed up and there just not picked out and made over cooked. Next thing I wanna point out is what happened to $1 burger night? The waterfront location has it listed on there site that they still do it. The waiter had mentioned that all burgers where now $5 bucks and included fries. So I decided to try the (spiked bulleit bourbon burger) and what a let down. The burger was over cooked from me asking for it medium rare. The bun did not seem fresh, the overall taste of the burger was good but it could have been so much better. A big note to mention is I guess with the burger being $5 bucks they skip on the fries cause I had almost none on my plate. When the bill came my burger said it was $6 and my guest was $5. Both burgers being short on fries and just overly disappointed. I really hope things change because I use to love bar Louie but any more I'm not sure if I'll be returning sadly.

-0AwwDqFDSyZQUiwhz9Uag.text: Real busy place for St. Patty's day, but Marissa was super fast and got our drinks right away.  I will definitely go back.

yIr73ucP3aye5hN54rtDjA.text: It's a chain, but it had a great atmosphere! Found myself here on St. Patrick's day weekend with 9 lovely ladies. Service is fantastic shout out to Samantha!!! She made sure we had drink ordered before we needed one. Food is good, nothing revolutionary, but there are a lot of great options.

4ZXH8xq3nS5K3SlDWhu9hA.text: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Specifically, the bartender Marissa provided a experience that was far above expectations by making recommendations specific to our tastes. She asked questions to learn more about what we were looking for, and her recommendations turned out perfectly. Thank you for this experience! We WILL be back!

teaMZvNWe8cU584UWNUcNQ.text: Excellent bar wait staff. They really took care of a beer snob like me. They asked me about my reaction to the beer (which as a substitute to the tap handle). Food was good and the beer selection pretty good.

jNFWaMxgt5J0XP_rUQw9Ew.text: I've been to bar Louie a few times and always had a good experience, however, yesterday was phenomenal. My friends & I went for dinner on a 75 degree day & wanted to sit somewhere outside. We had a group of 10 & tried to go to southern tier next door, however, the wait was an hour and a half. Bar Louie was able to seat us all outside immediately. Our server was awesome, everyone's meals and checks were correct, and we were all so happy with the food and service we received. It's hard to wait on a group on 10 people and have everyone leave happy campers.  As an appetizer, we had a few orders of the bruschetta and it was DELICIOUS. I highly recommend it. My husband got the street tacos, which were great. They come out on a hot plate similar to fajitas & you build them yourselves. I had the salmon sliders & loved them. The salmon was cooked perfectly. I would have never thought to order the salmon sliders, but our waitress recommended them and they did not disappoint. Whoever thought of putting salmon on a mini bun is a genius. Others at our table ordered burgers, flatbread & a few other items. Everyone would not stop talking about how great their meals were. I'd also like to add that the prices are incredibly affordable.  To wrap things up, if you are in the north shore looking for a great meal, awesome service, and an overall pleasant experience, check it Bar Louie!

xQ5L3H2Kv5zGVnw8XTNECg.text: Ashley L. Our server was awesome. Gracious and helpful in what to eat. Helped me with my beer choice which was excellent. More staff like her.

QBMmVtRXfzGRDS4p0h7mVA.text: Stopped in for a bite before the Steeler game. Waited 1 1/2 hours for our food while watching the cooks go out to smoke and the waitress didn't write our order down and apparently just gave us whatever she decided to put into the computer and nobody did anything about it. Probably ok on a non event day but never again on a game day.

Do-ZVrd2-rG3eUqQEDmFVQ.text: We had the worst meal that took over an hour and service was TERRIBLE. I can appreciate that it was a busy night but the wait times were still ridiculous and when the food finally came out it was cold and soggy. Very disappointed. Will not be back.

tRI8mF30WsVYyVXbhgKJug.text: I was feeling self conscious about my hair and Marissa made me feel so much better about it. Made great drinks and had the best jokes I've ever heard. I'll be back here all summer

-1LU29758vTUtWxARMdqTQ.text: I went here after a Steeler's game, so it was packed and there was about a 35 minute wait. To be honest, this is one of the most average places I've been to. The bartenders gave very mediocre service, however once we were seated at a table the service was a little better. I got the mac n cheese and it was okay- nothing to write home about and pretty bland.   I'm sure the crowd had a huge impact on my experience and I hope that it's better when they are as busy.

kz3lk-Ne7jIWG0XEFfaLDA.text: The restaurant was initially busy, but those tables were already eating and many were slowly, VERY slowly being cleaned. We waited roughly a half hour for our chips and dip. At the hour and 20 minute mark, when a table after us got their food first (we ordered very quickly) we knew we were not a priority. At this point we tried to pay for our appetizer, drinks and leave. When we asked for the bill the servers scattered and essentially acted like that was not an option. We set a little more money on the table than our bill should have been and left. Nobody made an attempt to help/stop us. Chips and dip were good. Salsa, queso and guacamole!

InBJ7EcNo_Tn2vCTukl_zA.text: Packed and service was great! Fish tacos were tasty. Husband ordered chicken and waffles. Very small. He left satisfied only after finishing my tacos. Very loud but fun atmosphere.

EjPSgRJx8hLXv9PJ7X0IVw.text: Our waitress, Samantha, was wonderful. She was dealing with the March Madness crowd and still checked on us and made sure we were great! Great selection of taps, and our waitress literally made us laugh the whole night. Veggie flatbread was also bomb

i6DwvgDrV8IfER5eF3tRWA.text: This is my favorite bar in the area!!!!! Kevin the manager is amazing!! His hospitality really has no comparison. Our server Ashely was a doll and throughly explained everything, she even remade our order due to an onion dislike ...   The bartender Amanda?! OMG .. best drinks Evers!!!   If you're in town for the game, there's no where else to stop

u3DC_pPsKRJHnKTT-BugYA.text: SAMANTHA, our waitress tonight was fantastic! We had so much fun with her and loved the happy hour specials! She was fun, outgoing, and personable - made the experience!

bGaJppOeD06aiPDJoTEeZQ.text: I have been to Bar Louie a few times, and unfortunately have been a little less than impressed. First of all, I want to say, that the service I've received there has been great. 5 stars. The food has been a little underwhelming. I have tried burgers and flatbreads, and all left me a little disappointed. I'm not sure if maybe because they were busy, but there is some opportunity in that area. I am not giving up on them just yet, because the appetizers I've had were pretty decent. I love the outdoor space there, and it's a nice spot to grab a drink before a concert or game. If you've never been, don't write it off, but maybe make it the drinks and apps spot!

vgCeyqJ7924I_60C16bKbg.text: Honestly, I wouldn't give this place five stars if it wasn't for Marissa. The best bartender. A busy bar and she still took care of us!

WgGBKDXqIGH0zRIzck_WHA.text: Visiting and stopped on in... it was amazing! Ate at the bar, the girls were very nice and very helpful on the " what to e explore" suggestions.

3G54rYhMCCXw9H8gXO6gzA.text: Ashley waited on us tonight and was very helpful with our menu selections and was very prompt to take care of us with drinks, apps, etc. Good atmosphere and great customer service. Will certainly be back.

Nm6lneA6_EEhMhdP9aUDKg.text: 4 of us sat outside on a busy early evening before a Pirate game. Took forever to get a waitress to take our order. Finally brought out a Coke to one of us, but we waited another 10 minutes and never received the 3 beers. Left $3 on the table and went to the game. I will never go back again.

sCxKJixgrGwhR_8fPjW4Ng.text: Parking can be a challenge during events like concerts or sporting events. The food is good and so are the drinks. Lots of appetizers for happy hour and specialty drinks. I'm not sure I'd go over to the North Shore just because. If I were going to an event I'd definitely stop here because I'm in the area. Friendly staff and very spacious. Patio area for a nice day and they have clean bathrooms which is always appreciated.

BROuKoho4vlOC8d7b1b4iw.text: Came for happy hour with a group of friends. They had a wide variety of select apps that are half off and the drink specials were reasonable. My husband loved the s'mores martini, while I liked the selection of beers. Our server was fun and friendly and did a fantastic job while training two new servers! Definitely coming back again soon.

mhXgWd1JL_zxxUD5iHuyvg.text: I've never really had any decent experiences at Bar Louie. We came just because we had a coupon for a free appetizer & it was late, so we chose to eat here. It was a Wednesday night around 9 PM, and there were probably 4 other parties in the whole place. We seated ourselves and about 1 minuet later our waiter came over & asked for our drinks. He brought our waters and there was lipstick on my glass. After telling him, he promptly brought another glass. We ordered our food and waited maybe 15 minutes for the food to arrive.  I ordered the Shrimp Margherita flatbread and my boyfriend got the buffalo wings. The flatbread was great! Just enough tomatoes, oil, and dressing. The only thing I would suggest would be to add more shrimp.  His wings were very VERY crispy. Like no meat, all crisp. I'm one who typically prefers crispier wings but these were way too overdone. They had a good amount of buffalo sauce on them though. If we were actually paying for these wings, we would've sent them back. But since they were free, we decided to stay quiet.

RAnB2xzXGMKmO16GAxj0zQ.text: Ashely was THE BEST! Recommended an an amazing perfectly mixed drink (get the clover), the service was fast and the food was amazing!

uPb4ZlhLK5KbvMwpdoxM4w.text: Nice place to stop in for some pub food. The menu isn't very extensive but if you like burgers and sandwiches it's a fine place to eat. I ordered the salmon sliders and they were delicious. They have lots of beer on tap but the selection isn't great for a real beer enthusiast. For most people it is plenty though. Prices are fair. The restaurant is on a strip with several other good places to eat.

EiMmbIcoMeB60J0bGiRY6g.text: After a pirates game, we decided to grab a bite to eat and we ended up here. We could seat ourselves at this time which was pretty convenient for us . We had 6 people in the party with 1 baby, so we wanted to sit in an area with some space.   Our server was attentive and funny. He had excellent suggestions for us and he came to check on us plenty of times   I wasn't super hungry so I got the pretzels and they were so yummy with a cinnamon butter ! My boyfriend got a burger with fries with an egg on the burger . My friend had a salad and tacos I believe.   Overall great experience with good prices for the items we ordered. We would come back here for the service alone because it was good on this game day

eaHeeIqel-HOZOQ7YF0pRQ.text: We had excellent service from Nikki.  Appetizers were tremendous. Great atmosphere for group drinks.

iblDlPmFMa2ksXeQOCnqXw.text: My husband and I had come in to watch the Laker game and have quick bite.  It was mid-week & late night, so there were only a few people there.  We sat at the bar area, since that's where everyone was.  We had a couple apps and shared.  One word--Bruchetta!!  If you like bruschetta, dont leave this place without trying theirs.  It's served in a oversized martini shaped platter.  The tomatoes were firm and tasted fresh.  The bread was not too hard and toasted just right.  Service was cool because it wasn't crowded, so the bartender was very attentive and checked on us frequently.  Everything on tap was cold and the area was kept very clean.

Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings

0FjoFLnn1s0yyAIwluDrew.text: Pleasantly surprised and impressed with the food here.  Before my most recent trip, I've only been here for drinks.  One of our friends had her birthday here and I'm glad she did.  The food was much better than your typical "bar restaurant".  I ended up ordering a burger and sharing some tuna poke and nachos.  The burger was cooked perfectly and the appetizers were great as well.  Heads up, the nachos feed about 4 grown adults so don't make the mistake of ordering that yourself like my brother did.

Xk2UI1pr59oLEyUqOS4VqA.text: Came here for the third time. This was my least favorable experience. It was Saturday evening and we sat on the patio and had a beer and appetizer. The chicken nachos are a big portion and good. My only knock for this experience was the service. We waited at least 30 min for the wait staff to come check on us, so we could get our check. It was very apparent the other customers were growing impatient as well.   This service is not the norm for bar Louie, so I would still return as the prices and food are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken nachos and Michelob ultra

viIIHc6Vl_TprRj6nDz5JQ.text: Came here after Pitt game yesterday and while the server was nice and attentive the food was awful! Ordered the bbq ranch salad with chicken but it never came with the chicken and the salad itself was just old brown lettuce, a few tomatoes and onion strings for $10.50! Also got the chips & queso and the chips were stale especially for $9. With so many options on north shore to eat & drink they really need to step it up.

FtNW-zZ2FdnZUYcHDRuhqA.text: Whenever I think of Bar Louie, I mentally shrug. That's because whenever I visit one of their locations, I usually find overpriced food (compared to what you can find elsewhere) and a so-so atmosphere. Such was the case with this Bar Louie.   I came here a few months ago to celebrate a friend's birthday. I'll say it now: our party was quite large and did take a while to arrive. So while sometimes I went a while without being checked on by the staff, I'm willing to let it slide. It was Friday; we were a big group; we were a big group that didn't arrive at once. That's a lot to keep track of. And by the end of my visit, it was getting so loud I could no longer hear myself thinking - so I can only imagine what it's like working through that din all evening!  I personally ordered the BLT wedge (with salmon added) and a cocktail, and shared the nachos as an appetizer with the table. The salad was decent - the nacho chips, however, were stale and bland. And honestly, that's all I can really say, because in addition to being relatively expensive, Bar Louie's food is pretty average at best. I never find the ingredients or flavors particularly memorable. My main dish was exactly what I expected; the stale nachos were sadly disappointing.  My visit overall was pretty much what I expected. I knew I was coming here to enjoy time with friends more than the place itself. So Bar Louie served its purpose. I admittedly I will not run back to visit soon.

BsrNInoqrY44vxHQ-j86XA.text: This was my first time at a Bar Louie and certainly won't be my last! I went with a group of friends for happy hour. The happy hour drinks and menu options were fantastic! I really enjoyed the Louie Cosmo and the Thai Chicken Flatbread. Their happy hour ran until 7pm, which was perfect for our group.

BqXnGFAtf-OGVNMIJHXNsA.text: Marissa was lights out, whiskey drinks were flowing.... my friend thought she was quite the eye candy too

QX0Sosp4_OtKYH36kirqHg.text: Definitely appreciate 5 dollar burgers (Tuesday night)! Been here plenty of times for food and drinks. This one is located in the north shore which I love. Unfortunately the drinks are not consistent. Ive ordered the strawberry lemonade sangria multiple times and it's always a different color and a different flavor (which ranges from amazing to yuK) Typically they're good (sweet, but good). Unfortunately yesterday it was terrible :/  The Manhattan was reportedly pretty amazing (according to my coworkers).  Beer is always served cold (another plus). Servers are friendly and it has a restaurant/bar vibe with "lounge-y" areas. Worth checking out (especially late night since the kitchen is open very late!)

5vI_7EzyVqawoS6yNP2sAA.text: First time in Pittsburgh and the food does not disappoint! The Ahi Poke was fresh and the medley of flavor was very tasty. Service was also excellent - Chantel was on top of it the entire time and I never once had to ask for a drink refill, plus she was very friendly and personable.

photos.caption: Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Eonb_Z5Mb9JJFnEZkBRMXw.text: This gastrobar is located at waterfront, and is a perfect location with a movie theatre, shopping area etc. within walking distance.  The ambiance and vibe in the place is great, typical to what you would expect of a gastrobar. In addition to the seating around the bar area there is also separate tables and chairs set up around the place.  Service is great!  I haven't tried many dishes on the menu but my husband who is a die hard burger fan loves their burgers. The Cajun pasta here is the absolute best I've had anywhere in Pittsburgh!  Overall, it's a great place for a date night, or just to unwind after a long week. I wish they had some lounge seating too. Having said that, they do have an upper floor which I haven't explored, guess it's time to go again

3EdrU0kz1LkU1GguPyUWag.text: Literally one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant since moving to Pittsburgh. Marissa was on top of her game and super friendly! Her personality and cocktails made for an enjoyable night. The food was top notch as well!  PS - Marissa =

PDO_ppRUfMh406D3A2FKYw.text: I love Bar Louie. I have always loved Bar Louie. and I will continue to love Bar Louie as long as I live.   Their food is great, their atmosphere is lovely, and their music is bumping.   Make sure you try their Tot-chos!

-wJ2x8cX7FAz_12s3jneUg.text: I usually don't attend chains however we were in a pinch. This was by FAR the best blessing in disguise! The most attentive service on the busiest day! Samantha was the REAL MVP! She made sure we got everything we needed and more In the most timely fashion! She was friendly and prompt. I could not as for more !!!   Would truly come back to see her !

VhPEpn9XIXaNp_Jha30U0Q.text: Great place to go for happy hour! They have awesome specials on drinks and appetizers from 5-8 so you can enjoy yourself without spending too much. Drafts are $3.50 during happy hour and they have a good selection for practically everyone's preferred beer. We ordered the Chicken Nachos and Buffalo Chicken Flatbread, both of which were very good and enough to share. The ingredients in the nachos could have been mixed up better, so you didn't have a pile of black beans on one side and sour cream on the other. And I would have liked the Buffalo Chicken Flatbread to be a bit spicier, but I still enjoyed my meal. The staff was very friendly and checked in on us multiple times as we relaxed on the patio to make sure we had everyone we wanted, even with the restaurant being pretty busy. The manager even remembered us from the event we attended there previously and welcomed us back.

Photo of Bar Louie - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Nachos

j5JoQPcBdKKz9Rhy6Hi7dQ.text: This is a great place for happy hour! They have pretty good happy hour deals, the drinks are good, and the food is as well. I've been here a few times and have always enjoyed my experience. It can be a little pricey, but if you come during happy hour or when they have some other deal the pricing is average.   The service has been great every time I've been, employees are nice and attentive. It's usually not crazy busy, but even if it is the service is just as good which is always a plus.  I enjoy the darker lighting and relaxing atmosphere, it makes it a great place for happy hour in my opinion. The quieter calm atmosphere makes it easier to have a conversation with your friends/coworkers because you don't have to try to talk over loud music.

ZuTWsVFwTp5YrGO4EzI0ew.text: Came here the other night and was very impressed.  Food was good and our service was execellent. Had Samantha T.  as a server and she was so attentive and gave great recommendations! Will definitely be back again and will be requesting her as a server if she is working!!

-6_WMJbK6H9JXvUQnx7PwA.text: I've been to Bar Louie a handful of times before and it's always been good. I recently went to the North Shore location and had a wonderful experience. I was with a party of 10 and we wanted to sit outside so they sat us right away. They were very accommodating to our large party. Our server was amazing! She had great suggestions and everything came out perfect! Everyone loved their food and kept saying how delicious it was. You must get the bruschetta...one of the best bruschetta's I've ever had and I love the presentation. Also, the burger sliders were really good and a decent size, very filling. All the food is reasonably priced. Everyone in our party left satisfied. Great food, great service, great experience!

URLrblRLcx0CQbhehqH1hA.text: Great Effin Cucumber Martini. Really bad service. Ordered 2 sodas and 2 drinks from outside table. Got sodas and waited for drinks for 30mins. Asked multiple servers for help. Eventually went up to bar myself to find them sitting there awaiting the waitress who never came. Old wash rag left on table. Asked one of the servers if they'd like to take it away and they replied it wasn't theirs. Enough said.

zw4QOydqAaypGd2F6w9Dtw.text: By far the worst restaurant experience I have had in the city of Pittsburgh. Service was atrocious and the food was absolutely horrendous. Ordered fish "tacos" and got chemical flavored fish with soggy lettuce, canned black beans, and bland rice. Oh and let's not forget the oxidized (black) avocado slice on top of my disgusting fish. 10/10 would not recommend. Pathetic.  Also, to top off the pathetic food, the food was freezing. AND, this is a huge no-no for me, we received the salads 25 minutes after ordering and then got our entrees about 2 minutes later. Didn't eat my salad, which by the way was soggy with tomato juice. Just a bad experience. Bill was $73 and the horrible waiter got $4. And I thought that was generous. And also, we were one table out of maybe 4. Service should not be bad especially when this incompetent waiter had 3 tables. Save your money and eat somewhere else. I regretted not eating in PNC Park.  Sorry for being blunt.

lRey-s9T9fTVG7uQJbMFow.text: It was just there. $7 for a vodka soda that really lacked in the vodka department. Service was that of a dive bar, hell I think you may get more personality at a dive. Wouldn't revisit this corporate place.

RrOISQIrspr9aeGGxpIKNA.text: I have been to the Bar Louie in the North Shore a bunch of times and I have never been disappointed. The drinks are great, the food is great, and the atmosphere is fun! The Sparklin' Ruby martini is phenomenal.

fatRaj7VA4kRR_ynH_pGGw.text: Went here because of the astronomically long line at Burgatory. I had been to the Station Square location so I figured this would be a great place to try after the Pens game. There was literally nobody there, a far cry from the scene at Burgatory, which is always packed to the max (so much so that it's annoying). I got a burger which was fantastic. I believe it was called the southwest burger, because it had jalepenos, guacamole, and onions. The tots that I got with it weren't bad either. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because the waitress had literally no clue about any of the beers I had asked about. I understand that its a newer restaurant, but I feel like the staff should have some idea what alcohol they're serving. She was nice and we joked about it, but I do feel like they should still know about all the beers they have on tap. My girlfriend got a martini, which she seemed to enjoy. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to wait an hour to be seated next door.

B78gu3ggaqJT0M8gXlYHyA.text: I stopped in to Bar Louie for a few hours before the Pirates home opener. It was pretty cold out for a Pirates game, so there wasn't as many people hanging outside as there will be in the near future. The inside looked beautiful. Art work was great, the tables were very intimate. The staff seemed to have their stuff together. All the bartenders seemed to be in a good mood. The outside was very inviting with a little fire pit and some low chairs and tables surrounding it. I noticed 2 garage doors that will open when the weather is nicer for easier in and out access to their outside. This is by far the nicest outside area of any place on the North Shore. Their tater tots are always great, so you can't go wrong with those. loaded or not. They have what seemed to have about 45 beers on draft, a large range of wines, craft cocktails, and awesome looking Martinis. I noticed some pretty good happy hour specials as well. This is probably going to be my new go-to spot on the north shore for the summer. 2 Thumbs up for me. I had a great time.

uPtM0jaO3er-E8zzaYAmPQ.text: The bartender Brandon was the saving grace of this particular evening. My boyfriend and I came to Bar Louie North Shore for a late dinner. We were greeted by Brandon and we sat outside. The server outside Kenny , I believe his name is, did not acknowledge us in any way. My boyfriend went inside and the bartender ended up taking our order and serving us. He was  very engaging and apologized for the server, who never even looked our way, but continued to serve other customers. I give this location 3 stars because of Brandon only. Thanks for saving our night!

Y7imnirBvXcAAG5uV7oRug.text: No, no, never!  If i could give 0 stars, that would be fitting. With 500,000 visitors to the city tonight, this restaurant appeared to make efforts to deter guests. Staff evaded EVERY table on the patio and indoors was equally pathetic. We waited 90+ minutes AFTER seated for food and only got 1/2 our order. Sorry kids, no dinner for you :(. Never saw a single table get bussed and likewise i think the kitchen bailed. If what we witnessed indicates the level of care, I fear what I didn't see taking place in kitchen. It was the worst display of restaurant management ever. Those poor servers!

ucAiq_0--xWFB6RdR81ryw.text: Possibly worst bar service in Pittsburgh with mediocre food. Avoid it if you can and head to a different north shore location.

Pmqw-5BmtZTyjB3l34GS7Q.text: I've been to bar Louie twice in my lifetime once eight years ago in cranberry Pennsylvania and now on the northside. Both turned out to be the same exact situation poor service horrible food and wondering how this restaurant chain stays in business.

Sw8gq2ra4aLfFslqUGJJEg.text: Food was ok. I ordered a fried Louie and ordered it med well. But my egg came out overdone and burger well done. My coworker had tacos and the tortillas were not even warm. Cold and breaking apart. Upside was the Drinks are really good.

NaO5YxAhSwMeBkwdClnRPQ.text: Bar Louis, as I so affectionately like to refer to Bar Louie as, always exceeds my expectations. The bartenders are always attentive and nice. The servers on the patio are always exceptional and splendid. Happy hour is a True delight and Tuesday $5 burgers couldn't be better. We will be back. Every. Single. Day. Bye!

a1QOmOjMijrY-WQItnRGkw.text: Went with a couple friends and it had to be the worst restaurant/bar I have ever been to. 1st the service is horrible. 2nd they were out of about every kind of beer we asked for. 3rd same as 2 only with food this time, everything we tried to order they were out of. 4th it took so long for everything to get to us. 5th food is just down right over priced slop. Especially the macaroni and cheese. I would not feed that to my worst enemy. I had to hit one star to post this. Lol

t8-hjLAh5XgmlWgQsJ4MJA.text: Here before the Beyonce concert, the bartenders are absolutely killing it with the tons of people in here. Devin and Alexis were especially helpful - will definitely be back soon! The R&R cocktail was delicious, Hendricks Gin and watermelon syrup.

yigutgcTyQABm14Py2IfVw.text: I can't speak for the other reviews on here, but we had a pretty great experience at Bar Louie's North Shore location.  We went before a pirate game, it wasn't too crowded and we were seated and greeted almost right away.  Great happy hour specials and the food was mostly delicious too.  Only complaint I have is the guacamole (part of the trio dips appetizer), it was pretty much just mashed up avocado, no seasoning or onion or anything in it.  We came on $5 burger night as well, turkey burger is delicious!  Highly recommend it here, just don't go for the guac.

mzeoi8lBtO2Gnfy9l4jZfA.text: Terrible customer service.  Our bartender was unprofessional and lazy.  I would recommend going next door to Burgatory or Southern Tier.

OReEq9Tkls9Lq1TZ8tK_JQ.text: It was our first time at Bar Louie and we had an AMAZING experience. We ordered lots of delicious, beautiful food that tasted incredible. My boyfriend and I dine out frequently and we were extremely impressed with our bartender, Brooke Tate. She greeted us with a big smile and was extremely knowledgeable with the menu. All of her recommendations for food and alcohol were spot on. Her personality radiated the room and she was absolutely delightful. We were so impressed by her that because of her service we will be coming back all the time! Great great service and we can't wait to come back for more. Thanks Brooke!!

k1CYqN4qDcKAzczxynrFbw.text: Wesley is one handsome stud and his service can't be beat. When I'm down in North Shore, it's Bar Louie or nothing. Can't wait for Pirate's season - I'll be here early to get the best seat!

8ONg6Za2VgX1GDzsBr3vgA.text: Drinking before Beyonce .... The bartenders are killing it here. I'm a bartender and they have been straight taking care of me and my crew really well!!!! Mojito is on point.   Mainly Devin and manager Alexis are the best! Just got their names ... Props to those gals!

1UYfpfe-IyL37692MDAvHQ.text: Came to Bar Louie for dinner with a family member who had an assignment as a floater chef in the area. You can eat inside or outside. We choose to eat outside and it has a great view of the water and bridge (lights up red at night). The restaurant has really good food (pictures posted).
